note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
D03C9/04 covered by D03C9/028
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Single-lift dobbies, i.e. dobbies in which the same draw-knife or equivalent operates for every pick
Double-lift dobbies, i.e. dobbies in which separate draw-knives or equivalent operate on alternate picks
reversible, i.e. correct sheds open automatically when the loom is driven backwards
Centre-shed dobbies, i.e. shed formed by lifting some threads and lowering the others from central shed-closed position
Dobbies employing toothed gearing instead of draw-knives
Features common to dobbies of different types

reference.text: stop motions acting on defective operation of shedding mechanisms D03D51/46

title-part.text: Arrangements of dobby in relation to loom
Facilitating engagement of lifting-hooks with draw-knives
by creating and then eliminating back-lash between hooks and knives
wherein all the hooks are disengaged from the knives, and selected hooks then re-engaged
wherein all the hooks are engaged with the knives, and unselected hooks then disengaged
Arrangements wherein warp threads pass one another at different heights to avoid congestion
Card- or chain-saving arrangements, e.g. cross-border dobbies

reference.text: controlling jacquard by scanning design D03C17/06; for gripper Axminster looms D03D39/08

title-part.text: Multiple-shed jacquards, i.e. jacquards which move warp threads to several different heights, e.g. for weaving pile fabrics
Jacquards not employing lifting-hooks, e.g. employing knotted cords in conjunction with keyhole slots
Verdol or other jacquards having intermediate power-operated needles between reading needles and lifting-hooks
Features common to jacquards of different types
General arrangements of jacquards, or disposition in relation to loom
Arrangements for preventing next shed from being opened during stopping of loom
Arrangements wherein hooks are positively operated to close shed
Cam or other direct-acting shedding mechanisms, i.e. operating heald frames without intervening power-supplying devices
operated by cam devices other than rotating cams

CPC-specific-text.text: Combined leno and patterned shedding motion

title-part.text: Mechanisms having discs oscillating about a weftwise axis and having apertures for warp threads
Mechanisms having eyed needles for moving warp threads from side to side of other warp threads
Devices for twisting warp threads repeatedly in the same direction

CPC-specific-text.text: Heald bars or their connection to other frame parts
Distance guides for keeping distance to the next frame
Intermediate supports or their connection to other frame parts
Corner connections between horizontal rods and side stays
Arrangements or means for the linking to the drive system
Arrangements of means for damping or noise reduction

title-part.text: Selvedge shedding mechanisms not forming part of main shedding mechanism

reference.text: selvedge jacquards D03C3/18; leno selvedge mechanism D03C7/00

title-part.text: Shedding mechanisms not otherwise provided for
Chains of metal, wood, or similar material with projecting pattern-indicating elements
Cards or paper perforated to indicate pattern
Apparatus for setting pegs in, or removing pegs from, pattern cards
Apparatus for interconnecting, e.g. by lacing, or disconnecting pattern cards

reference.text: marking record carriers in digital fashion G06K

title-part.text: manually-controlled, i.e. holes to be punched determined by the operator
automatic, i.e. design scanned optically or otherwise to control punching apparatus or to control loom jacquard directly
Miscellaneous methods or devices concerned with designing or making patterns
Devices for levelling the heald frames
Coupling and uncoupling the drive for the heald frames
Devices for holding the shed open
Arrangements in which warp threads pass one another at different heights
Devices for adjusting the geometric and time parameters of shed opening
Devices for levelling the heald frames
Coupling and uncoupling the drive for the heald frames
Devices for holding the shed open
Devices for adjusting the geometric and time parameters of shed opening
